result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent M. Herreman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay costs totaling $443 within 60 days unless a payment plan is set with Clerk of Courts office
Concurrent with: to 14CF91; with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt:
Called cases 14CF91 and 14CF258. Defendant Brent M. Herreman in court with attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews PQ&WOR, charges, penalties and rights, Def. pleads NC to Ct. 1 in 14CF91 and NC to Ct 2. in 14CF258. Court finds factual basis, Court accepts plea and finds Def. guilty of said counts, ct. 1 in 14CF258 is DRI. Atty Klomberg heard, Atty Luchsinger heard, Nicole Herreman makes statement, Atty Klomberg heard, Def. makes statement, Court heard, imposes sent.:

14CF91
5 yrs DCI, 3 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES - imposed and stayed
3 yrs P&P
6 mos DCJ w/ H&T (for work and treatment)
any treatment by agent
absolute sobriety of any drugs and alcohol
obtain full time job
ERP
challenge incarceration
costs
surcharge
2 days sent. credit
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

(12:45) Defendant Brent M. Herreman in custody via video with attorney Jessica M. Moeller (will appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Address and DOB verified; Prelim requested waiving time limits. PH set 9/18/14 at 8:30am in Br. 2; Court sets bond at $500.00 PA BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
